intro: Antimima turneriana, commonly known as the Turner's antimony plant, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers. It is known for containing various alkaloids, some of which have medicinal properties. However, it is also toxic and should be handled with care.
